dcterms:creator: W. Bennett
D. W. Ward
J. Robertson
dcterms:description: ACIDS uses a seismic and an acoustic sensor, both at a 1024 Hz sampling rate, to record vehicles moving towards and away from the sensing zone. On average, the dataset contains 45 minutes of recordings (per sensor) per target class, segmented into two-second chunks with one-second overlap. It encompasses 135 sessions from 9 vehicle types across 3 terrains: arctic (snow/ice), normal (city roads), and desert (sand).
dcterms:title: ACIDS (Acoustic-seismic Classification Identification Data Set)

dcterms:creator: T. Sztyler
H. Stuckenschmidt
dcterms:description: The RealWorld-HAR dataset captures data from 6 modalities, including accelerometer, GPS, gyroscope, light, magnetic field, and sound level. Sensors are placed on 7 body positions. It features 5 activities including walking, running, stairs up/down, and jumping, recorded from 15 human subjects.
dcterms:title: RealWorld-HAR

dcterms:creator: B. Alsaify
M. M. Almazari
R. Alazrai
M. I. Daoud
dcterms:description: This dataset records Wi-Fi signal variations caused by indoor human activities. It features 12 activities, performed by 30 human subjects across 3 environments. Each session involves 20 repetitions of activities.
dcterms:title: Wireless-sensor-based human activity recognition dataset
